channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Diesel /oil leakage, 1st November
item.description:
Vehicle that is leaking excessive amounts of oil/diesel onto the road. Making it hazardous for animals and children that play in the area. It is used regularly in the Cheltenham area by GrassScape company in Cheltenham "www.GrassScape.co.uk. Vehicle is outside the St Pauls Hub side of the walk, in the area of numbers 15,16 St Pauls Walk. Vehicle Reg: DK08 BGV, Mitsubishi Fuso supposedly in White but is painted Grey. It is also on the other side of the walk outside number 15 (GL50 4GG) garden wall area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Paul's Walk, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I believe that there is giant hogweed on the grass verge close to a public footway that is used by many people everyday., 1st November
item.description:
Exact location is Wainlode Lane, Norton, between Lime Close, Norton (house numbers 17 &18) and Cook Lane, Norton. The plants that I believe may be Giant Hogweed were looking exactly like cow parsley during the summer but they are/were well over 2m tall. Obviously they are now dead/dry but if they have seeded and spread this will cause a lot of problems next spring. Also I don’t know if there is any danger to the public if anyone was to touch them in their present condition.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wainlode Lane, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 1st November
item.description:
St Annes Terrace, Cheltenham - A one way sign has been put up at the junction with Hewlett Road however as it is not clearly visible, it is causing rumours and confusion amongst residents whether this is now enforced or not. There are no road markings and vehicles are still entering the road from Hewlett Road. Can vehicles still legally enter the terrace from Hewlett Road or would this be classed as an offence?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 1st November
item.description:
Thank you for reply. Sorry for the delay in replying, I have been away. Please see the attached photos. 1 - larger photo of pothole area 2 - close up of pothole 3 - what 3 words of rough area 4 - my route on the day 5 - end of route where the blow out happened in line with what3words 6 - size of tyre showing that the pothole would have an impact on the bike. Normally, I would ride further into the road, but I was forced to ride more to the left by overtaking vehicle. Fortunately, the blow out of the back tyre didn’t cause me to come off the bike. Regards
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, Fairview Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Damage to edge of road in numerous areas along Gotherington Lane, 1st November
item.description:
As you travel towards Gotherington, there are a number of areas of road edge which have been damaged and have large potholes or similar loss of integrity. This has occurred since the changes were recently made. The road is narrow at best, and these make margins for error very small, and fill with water after heavy rain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cleeve Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double yellow lines painted in error on parking bay, 1st November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Back Montpellier Terrace, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large pothole by the curb, 1st November

item.title: Pavement has vegetation across about half its width, forcing the walker nearer the tast-moving traffic, 1st November
item.description:
The pavement on the N. side of the B4632 is obstructed from the junction with Langley Road to the top of the hill. Vegetation is growing over and next to the pavement, making it too narrow to use safely.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Loose/recessed manhole cover that rattles loudly when vehicles drive over it, 1st November
item.description:
There is a recessed/loose manhole cover on Leckhampton Road, by the entrance/exit of Fairfield Avenue. It is very noticeable and disruptive when larger vehicles drive over it, making a loud clattering sound that is very audible in local properties.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Fairfield Avenue, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 1st November
item.description:
